actions.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs.

committees.committee: Senate Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs

official_title: A bill to amend title 5, United States Code, to postpone the effective date of high-impact rules pending judicial review.
short_title: Require EValuation before Implementing Executive Wishlists Act of 2017

summary.text:
Require EValuation before Implementing Executive Wishlists Act of 2017 or the REVIEW Act of 2017

This bill prohibits a final agency rule from being published or taking effect until: (1) the agency submits the rule to the Office of Information and Regulatory Affairs (OIRA), and (2) OIRA makes a determination as to whether the rule is a "high-impact rule" that may impose an annual cost on the economy of at least $1 billion.

An agency shall postpone the effective date of a high-impact rule until the final disposition of all actions seeking judicial review of the rule.

titles.title: Require EValuation before Implementing Executive Wishlists Act of 2017

A bill to amend title 5, United States Code, to postpone the effective date of high-impact rules pending judicial review.
